column4: So, how bad is removing ubuntu-desktop exactly? Does it actually break updates?
It won't affect you until you upgrade from a version to the next (10.04 to 10.10, for instance) and if you use update-manager to do that upgrade, it'll take care of it.
Right then, I'll just go ahead and purge the vital system package known as ALSA.
It's a good thing I know what I'm doing, or this would arguably be insanely stupid.
